humanDesignResults.analysisDescription: Discover a deep and empathetic analysis of your Human Design, with guidance especially crafted for women.
humanDesignResults.generatingAnalysis: Generating analysis... (may take a few minutes)

humanDesignResults.invalidBirthDate: Invalid birth date. Please check the saved data.

analysisSections.introDescription: Personal Architecture is a system that combines astrology, I Ching, Kabbalah, and the chakra system to reveal your unique energetic nature. Your map shows how you were designed to interact with the world.
analysisSections.notSelfDescription: When you're not living your strategy, you tend to experience {{theme}}. This is a sign that something is misaligned.
analysisSections.definitionDescription: Your definition shows how your energy centers are connected. This affects how you process information and interact with others.
analysisSections.rememberText: As a {{type}}, your strategy is "{{strategy}}". When you live according to your design, you experience natural satisfaction and alignment.

Generator.name: Generator
Generator.summary: You are the life force of the planet! Generators are the builders, the masters of sustainable work. With powerful sacral energy, you have the capacity to work with pleasure and satisfaction when doing what you love.
Generator.strategyDescription: Your strategy is to wait for life to bring things for you to respond to. Don't initiate - respond! When something arises in your field, your sacral will respond with an "uh-huh" (yes) or "un-un" (no). Trust that gut response.
challenges: Tendency to initiate instead of respond
Can feel trapped in wrong commitments
Frustration when forced to do what you don't like
tips: Practice listening to your "uh-huh" and "un-un"
Don't commit immediately - sleep on important decisions
Do what you love and the money will follow
Your aura is always seeking what's right for you

Manifesting Generator.name: Manifesting Generator
Manifesting Generator.summary: You are a powerful hybrid! You combine the sustainable energy of the Generator with the ability to manifest. You're faster than the pure Generator and can initiate after responding.
Manifesting Generator.strategyDescription: Like the Generator, you wait to respond. But unlike the pure Generator, after the sacral response, you can act quickly. Inform people around you about your actions to avoid resistance.
strengths: Can skip steps when responding correctly
tips: Wait for the sacral response before acting
Inform people about your plans
It's okay to change interests - follow your response
Use your energy for what satisfies you

Projector.name: Projector
Projector.summary: You are a natural guide! Projectors have the unique ability to see and understand others deeply. Your role is to manage, direct, and guide the energy of others.
Projector.strategyDescription: Wait to be recognized and invited to the big areas of life: career, love, where to live. When you're truly invited, your wisdom is received and valued.
strengths: Natural wisdom about systems and people
Ability to see potential in others
challenges: Risk of burnout if working like a Generator
May feel invisible if not recognized
tips: Wait for genuine invitations for what matters
Study what you love - become an expert
Rest frequently - you don't have sacral energy
Your value is in wisdom, not quantity of work

Manifestor.name: Manifestor
Manifestor.summary: You are a born initiator! Manifestors are the only ones who can truly initiate action. Your aura is closed and repelling, protecting your independence.
Manifestor.strategyDescription: You can initiate, but you must inform people affected by your actions BEFORE acting. This isn't asking permission - it's a courtesy that removes resistance from your path.
strengths: Doesn't need to wait for anyone
challenges: Difficulty informing - feels like asking permission
tips: Inform, don't ask permission
Find peace in solitude
Your anger indicates where you're not being free
Accept that not everyone will understand you

Reflector.name: Reflector
Reflector.summary: You are a mirror of the community! Reflectors are the rarest (~1% of population) and reflect the health of the environment around them. Without defined centers, you experience life uniquely.
Reflector.strategyDescription: For important decisions, wait a complete lunar cycle. During those 28 days, you'll experience different perspectives as the Moon transits through all gates.
challenges: Can get lost in others' energies
Difficulty knowing who you really are
Needs a lot of time for decisions
tips: Choose healthy environments - you reflect them
Use the lunar cycle for big decisions
You're not here to be like others
Your difference is your gift

Emotional.name: Emotional Authority (Solar Plexus)
Emotional.description: You have an emotional wave that rises and falls. Never make decisions at the peak or valley of the wave.
Emotional.howToUse: Wait for emotional clarity. Sleep on important decisions and observe how you feel about them at different times of day and on different days.
tips: There's no truth in the moment - wait
Observe the pattern of your wave
Clarity comes when you feel neutral about the decision
Say "I need time" when pressured

Sacral.name: Sacral Authority
Sacral.description: Your sacral center responds with guttural sounds - "uh-huh" (yes) or "un-un" (no). This is the most immediate and reliable response.
Sacral.howToUse: Ask yourself yes or no questions or have others ask you. Observe your body's response - it happens before thought.
tips: Practice responding to simple questions
The response comes from the gut, not the mind
If you don't have a response, it's not the time
Sounds and grunts are valid!

Splenic.name: Splenic Authority
Splenic.description: You have instant intuition that speaks once, very softly. It's the oldest survival instinct.
Splenic.howToUse: Pay attention to the subtle whispers of the body. Splenic intuition is instant and doesn't repeat - if you missed it, you'll have to wait for a new situation.
tips: The message is subtle and doesn't repeat
Trust the chills, shivers, sensations
Your intuition is about safety and well-being
Don't rationalize - act in the moment

Ego.name: Ego/Heart Authority
Ego.description: Your willpower and personal commitments guide your decisions. What do you want to do?
Ego.howToUse: Ask yourself: "What do I want?" and "Is it worth it to ME?". Your commitments must serve you first.
tips: Be selfish in the good sense - honor your desires
Don't make promises you can't keep
Your word is your law
What's good for you will be good for others

Self-Projected.name: Self-Projected Authority
Self-Projected.description: You need to talk about your decisions to hear your own truth. The voice reveals the direction.
Self-Projected.howToUse: Talk about your options with trusted people. Don't ask for advice - just talk and listen to what comes out of you.
tips: Find "sounding boards" - people who just listen
Record yourself talking about decisions
The truth is in the sound of your voice
Don't let others influence - just listen to yourself

Lunar.name: Lunar Authority
Lunar.description: As a Reflector, you need a complete lunar cycle (28 days) for important decisions.
Lunar.howToUse: Mark it on the calendar. During 28 days, talk about the decision, observe how you feel on different days, and wait for clarity to emerge.
tips: The Moon transits all gates in 28 days
You'll experience different perspectives
Don't rush - your wisdom is worth the wait
Big decisions deserve a complete cycle

None.name: Mental/Environmental Authority
None.description: You need the right environments and people to process decisions. You don't decide alone.
None.howToUse: Talk with different people in different places. Observe where you feel good to think and who helps you clarify.
tips: Your environment affects your clarity
Find trusted advisors
The mind isn't your authority - it's for others
Observe what emerges in conversations

1/3.name: Investigator/Martyr
1/3.description: You need a solid foundation of knowledge (1) and learn through practical experiences, including mistakes (3). You're a natural researcher who tests everything in practice.
1/3.conscious: Line 1 - The Investigator: Seeks security through deep knowledge. Needs to understand foundations before acting.
1/3.unconscious: Line 3 - The Martyr: Learns through trial and error. Life is a continuous experiment.

1/4.name: Investigator/Opportunist
1/4.description: You combine deep knowledge (1) with influence through personal networks (4). You share your expertise with those you know.
1/4.conscious: Line 1 - The Investigator: Seeks solid foundations of knowledge.
1/4.unconscious: Line 4 - The Opportunist: Influences through close relationships and established networks.

2/4.name: Hermit/Opportunist
2/4.description: You have natural talents that others recognize (2), and influence through personal connections (4). You need time alone to develop your gifts.
2/4.conscious: Line 2 - The Hermit: Possesses natural talents that need to be called out.
2/4.unconscious: Line 4 - The Opportunist: Opportunities come through the relationship network.

2/5.name: Hermit/Heretic
2/5.description: You have natural gifts (2) and are projected as a savior or solution to others' problems (5). You need isolation to recharge.
2/5.conscious: Line 2 - The Hermit: Innate talents that emerge when called.
2/5.unconscious: Line 5 - The Heretic: Attracts projections of being the "savior" - must deliver practical solutions.

3/5.name: Martyr/Heretic
3/5.description: You learn through experience (3) and have the potential to offer practical solutions that work (5). Your wisdom comes from what you've lived.
3/5.conscious: Line 3 - The Martyr: Discovers what works (and what doesn't) through direct experience.
3/5.unconscious: Line 5 - The Heretic: Others project on them the ability to solve problems.

3/6.name: Martyr/Role Model
3/6.description: You experience intensely in the first part of life (3), then go up to the "roof" to observe, and eventually become a role model (6).
3/6.conscious: Line 3 - The Martyr: First phase of life full of experimentation.
3/6.unconscious: Line 6 - The Role Model: After 50, emerges as authentic example of life lived.

4/6.name: Opportunist/Role Model
4/6.description: You influence through personal networks (4) and eventually become a role model for others (6). Relationships are fundamental.
4/6.conscious: Line 4 - The Opportunist: Opportunities flow through established connections.
4/6.unconscious: Line 6 - The Role Model: After maturing, becomes an example of life well-lived.

4/1.name: Opportunist/Investigator
4/1.description: You share deep knowledge (1) through your relationship network (4). You're an influencer with a solid foundation.
4/1.conscious: Line 4 - The Opportunist: Life happens through who you know.
4/1.unconscious: Line 1 - The Investigator: Unconscious base of research and foundation.

5/1.name: Heretic/Investigator
5/1.description: You're seen as someone who can solve problems (5), supported by deep knowledge (1). You project as a universalizer.
5/1.conscious: Line 5 - The Heretic: Attracts projections of being the savior or solution.
5/1.unconscious: Line 1 - The Investigator: Solid foundation that sustains your practical ability.

5/2.name: Heretic/Hermit
5/2.description: You have the projection of problem-solver (5) with natural talents that you prefer to exercise in privacy (2).
5/2.conscious: Line 5 - The Heretic: Called to offer practical solutions.
5/2.unconscious: Line 2 - The Hermit: Natural talents that need space to flourish.

6/2.name: Role Model/Hermit
6/2.description: You're destined to be a role model (6), with natural talents that emerge when called (2). You live in three distinct phases.
6/2.conscious: Line 6 - The Role Model: Three life phases - experimentation, observation, and role model.
6/2.unconscious: Line 2 - The Hermit: Natural gifts that others recognize in you.

6/3.name: Role Model/Martyr
6/3.description: You experience intensely in all phases of life (3+6). Your wisdom as a role model comes from lived experiences.
6/3.conscious: Line 6 - The Role Model: Destined to be an example after maturation.
6/3.unconscious: Line 3 - The Martyr: Continuous experimentation that feeds wisdom.

hdDefinitions.Single: Single Definition: All your defined centers are connected. You're energetically self-sufficient and don't need others to feel complete.
hdDefinitions.Split: Split Definition: You have two groups of defined centers that aren't connected. You may feel attraction to people who "connect" your parts.
hdDefinitions.Triple Split: Triple Split Definition: Three separate areas of definition. You may need multiple people or environments to feel integrated.
hdDefinitions.Quadruple Split: Quadruple Split Definition: Four separate areas. Very rare. You need time and diverse interactions to process.
hdDefinitions.No Definition: No Definition (Reflector): No defined centers. You're completely open and reflect the world around you.

hdPdf.introText: This report presents your complete Personal Architecture, a unique map of your vital energy based on the Human Design System. Discover how you were designed to make decisions, interact with the world, and live authentically.
hdPdf.bodygraphFallback: Your Bodygraph is available on the online platform.
hdPdf.summaryTemplate: {{defined}} defined center(s)  |  {{open}} open center(s)  |  {{channels}} active channel(s)
hdPdf.centersIntro: Within Human Design, the centers represent different areas of energy and influence various facets of our life and personality. Below, you will find the meaning of each of the centers with a special focus on women.
hdPdf.centersNote: (*) Indicates centers that are defined in your personal map.

intro.title: What is Human Design?
intro.content:
Human Design is a self-knowledge system that combines elements from various ancient traditions (astrology, I Ching, Kabbalah, chakra system) and modern ones (quantum physics and genetics) to help people better understand who they are and how they function in the world. It's like a personal map that shows us our unique characteristics and how we can live more aligned with our true nature.

The Centers in Human Design are similar to chakras and represent different aspects of human experience. They can be defined (colored) or undefined (white). Within Human Design, the centers represent different areas of energy and influence various facets of our life and personality.

centersTheory.name: Head Center
centersTheory.function: A center of inspiration and mental pressure.
centersTheory.importance: This center can influence how women process ideas and connect with inspiration. It's a starting point for questioning and doubts, frequently impacting how they perceive reality and seek meaning in their daily experiences.

centersTheory.name: Ajna Center
centersTheory.importance: Women with a defined Ajna may present a consistent way of thinking and forming opinions, while those with an undefined Ajna may be more open to new ideas and external influences. Consciousness here manifests in how they make decisions and interpret information.

centersTheory.name: Throat Center
centersTheory.importance: This center influences how women express their thoughts and feelings. The presence of a defined throat center may indicate a more consistent ability to communicate, while an undefined center may lead to adapting to others' communicative expectations.

centersTheory.name: G Center
centersTheory.importance: This center is deeply connected to the sense of identity and purpose. For many women, it reflects how they see themselves in relation to love and the direction they wish to follow in life. A defined G center can provide a strong sense of personal identity, while an undefined one may result in seeking direction through others' experiences.

centersTheory.name: Heart Center (Ego)
centersTheory.importance: This center impacts women's relationship with self-esteem and personal value. When defined, it may indicate strong willpower and commitment to goals, while an undefined center may make women feel challenged to prove their worth.

centersTheory.name: Sacral Center
centersTheory.function: Source of vital energy and work force.
centersTheory.importance: This is the center of vital energy, influencing work capacity and general vitality. Women with a defined Sacral may have sustained energy for work and projects, while those with an undefined Sacral may need more time for rest and recovery.

centersTheory.name: Spleen Center
centersTheory.importance: This center is linked to intuition and sense of well-being. A defined spleen center can provide a strong connection with intuition and health, while an undefined one may result in greater sensitivity to external health and well-being conditions.

centersTheory.name: Solar Plexus Center
centersTheory.importance: This center is crucial in managing emotions. Women with a defined Solar Plexus may experience a consistent range of emotions, while those with an undefined center may be more susceptible to others' emotions and emotional fluctuations.

centersTheory.name: Root Center
centersTheory.importance: How women deal with stress and pressure can be influenced by this center. A defined root center can provide a more constant approach to pressure management, while an undefined one may result in variations in stress response.

elements.title: Type
elements.content: Types are the first and most fundamental classification in Human Design. They determine how you interact with the world and how your energy flows. There are five main types: Manifestor (natural initiators, here to start things and act independently), Generator (builders, with sustained energy to work on projects they love), Manifesting Generator (a combination of both, with the ability to initiate and work sustainably), Projector (natural guides, here to guide others and need to be recognized and invited), and Reflector (mirrors of the environment, extremely sensitive and benefit from complete lunar cycles for decision-making).

elements.title: Strategy
elements.content: Strategy is related to type and is the most aligned way to interact with the world. Each type has its own strategy that, when followed, leads to its signature (satisfaction, peace, success, or surprise).

elements.title: Inner Authority
elements.content: It's the internal guide for making decisions more aligned with your true nature. Each person has a specific authority that serves as a compass for correct decisions.

elements.title: Definition
elements.content: Refers to how your centers in the chart are connected. This influences how a person processes information and energies, as well as interacts with others.

elements.title: Profile
elements.content: There are 12 different profiles. The profile is the combination of two numbers that reflect your role in life and how you see yourself and are seen by others.

elements.title: Incarnation Cross
elements.content: In the Human Design system, there are 192 different Incarnation Crosses. It reflects your life purpose, a combination of four gates that highlight main themes you will live.

elements.title: Signature
elements.content: There is a specific Signature for each of the five main Types. The Signature is the state of being that a person experiences when living according to their design, in alignment with their true nature, and provides a sense of fulfillment and well-being.

elements.title: Not-Self Theme
elements.content: Each of the five main types has a Not-Self Theme, which is the negative emotion or state a person experiences when not living according to their design. This theme indicates a misalignment with your true nature and serves as a warning sign.

variables.title: Digestion
variables.content: Refers to the best way to process food, affects, and information, optimizing physical and mental well-being.

variables.title: Design Sense
variables.content: Refers to the predominant senses through which a person perceives and interacts with the world.

variables.title: Motivation
variables.content: Refers to the internal impulses that guide a person in how they perceive and interact with the world. It provides a lens through which a person can better understand their actions and decisions.

variables.title: Environment
variables.content: Refers to the ideal type of environment where a person can thrive and function more aligned with their design. Understanding your Environment type can help you choose environments that support your physical and mental well-being.

gatesChannels.title: Gates and Channels
gatesChannels.content:
Gates represent a specific energetic characteristic or potential. Each gate represents a characteristic that may be activated in your Human Design chart. The 64 gates are distributed among the nine body centers in the chart. When two activated gates connect, they form a Channel, which links two centers.

Channels are 36 in total. These channels are formed by the connection of two Gates between two of the nine centers. Each channel represents a flow of energy and information between centers, influencing how a person processes experiences and interacts with the world.

When a channel is defined in your chart, it indicates a consistent way of operating that energy. Channels play a significant role in determining your Type, as they influence which centers are defined.

closing.title: How to Use Your Human Design
closing.content:
All these elements of Human Design help compose a detailed map of your individuality, offering insights on how to live more authentically and satisfyingly.

Human Design suggests that by understanding your type, strategy, authority, and other aspects of your personal chart, you can make more authentic choices and live more fluidly. It's a system that invites us to experiment with its guidance in daily life, observing how we feel more aligned and fulfilled.

Understanding Human Design can help you live according to your true nature, respecting your unique energy and potential. It's a powerful tool for self-knowledge and personal development.

Apetite.tips: Don't follow fixed schedules. Eat only when you feel genuine hunger. Avoid eating out of social obligation or routine.

Paladar.tips: Choose foods by flavor. If it doesn't taste good, don't force it. Your body knows what it needs through taste.

Sede.tips: Drink water or liquids during meals. Soups and broths are excellent. Hydration is essential for your digestion.

Toque.tips: Prefer hot or cold foods as your body requests. Creamy or crunchy textures make a difference for you.

Som.tips: Eat in calm environments or with pleasant music. Avoid arguments or loud TV during meals.

Luz.tips: Natural light is ideal for your meals. Avoid eating in the dark or under intense artificial light.

Cavernas.tips: Work in enclosed and cozy spaces. Offices, bedrooms, caves. Avoid areas that are too open.

Mercados.tips: Thrive in busy environments: cafes, coworking spaces, fairs. People's energy energizes you.

Cozinhas.tips: Kitchens, restaurants, nourishing places. Work near where food is being prepared.

Montanhas.tips: Seek high floors, viewpoints, mountains. You need panoramic views and broad perspective.

Vales.tips: Valleys, ground floors, secluded places. Low and protected environments favor your energy.

Margens.tips: Seaside, riverbanks, boundaries between environments. Transitions energize you: city/countryside, home/work.

Medo.tips: Create safety structures before taking risks. Plan contingencies. Your caution is wisdom, not weakness.

Esperan√ßa.tips: Visualize the best possible outcome. Your hope inspires others. Avoid very pessimistic people.

Desejo.tips: Identify what you truly want. Clear desires move you. Don't suppress your material or emotional aspirations.

Necessidade.tips: Attend to your fundamental needs first. Don't ignore hunger, sleep, rest. Take care of the basics before the extraordinary.

Responsabilidade.tips: Use your responsibility as strength, not a prison. Contributing to others fulfills you. Watch out for excessive guilt.

Inoc√™ncia.tips: Maintain your pure vision of things. Don't let cynicism corrupt you. Your innocence is a strength, not a weakness.

Sobreviv√™ncia.tips: Trust your ability to identify what's essential. You see threats and opportunities others ignore.

Possibilidade.tips: You see potential where others see problems. Use this vision to create new solutions and paths.

Poder.tips: Identify who holds real power in situations. Use your perception of power dynamics wisely.

Anseio.tips: You deeply understand what people want. Use this perception to create value and connections.

Probabilidade.tips: Trust your logical analysis of chances and risks. You see statistical patterns others don't notice.

Pessoal.tips: Your vision is unique and valid. Don't try to see as others see. Your personal perspective is your greatest asset.

Olfato.tips: Trust olfactory impressions. Aromas influence your decisions. Use perfumes and scents to your advantage.

Paladar.tips: Your taste is a decision guide. When something 'doesn't taste right,' pay attention. Flavors affect your mood.

Vis√£o Externa.tips: You process better what you see externally. Charts, images, visualizations help you. Observe the environment.

Vis√£o Interna.tips: Trust your mental visualizations and insights. Meditation and reflection deepen your perception.

Sentimento.tips: Your emotional sensations are valuable information. 'Feeling' a situation gives you data that logic can't reach.

Toque.tips: Physical contact is important for you to process information. Touching objects, people, textures connects you to reality.
